Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; cream slip; interior: glazed streaky black with rosette in added white outline with added red centres, above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lotus flower with some red in centre; dotted square as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies this sherd as belonging to the group of vases with floral decoration in the Simple Animal Style. The lotus flower and lotus bud pattern found on these vessels appears on the exterior surface of the vases and in the later vases the pattern resembles that found on Fikellura vases.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 307, no. 1256)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1006) (phase 2)
